text: The Order of the Sacred Treasure is a Japanese honor established in 1888 by Emperor Meiji. It recognizes individuals for their long-term public service or equivalent non-public service. The order has six classes, with the highest being the Grand Cordon and the lowest being the Silver Rays. It's awarded to those who have made distinguished contributions in fields like education, healthcare, social welfare, and government Category:1880s establishments in Japan
title: Order of the Sacred Treasure
